4 minas: the import duty on our father's tin; I paid in settlement 7 1/3 minas 5 shekels on food to Kurub-Ištar and Iddin-Ištar; we credited 18 shekels for food on the stretch from Hahhum; 1 donkey belonging to our father is dead; 5 1/2 minas 5 shekels of my tin: (for) Aššur-taklāku; regarding 15
To Elamma's shareholders and Elamma's representatives from  Aššur-ṣulūlī, Ikuppia, Aššsur-ṭāb, Ilabrat-bāni, Iddin-Ištar, Ennam-Aššur and Abu-šalim:
You have written, saying: "Open the strong-room in Elamma's house there, and seal both whatever silver is there and the copper there and send it here!"

Before Ilabrat-bāni, Ennam-Aššur and Abu-šalim arrived from Kaneš the sons of Hinnaya had opened the strong-room and taken a certified tablet concerning 21 minas of silver, the debt of Adad-ṣulūlī and Iddin-Ištar son of Aššur-nādā.
They said: "We take responsibility for any complaint by the shareholders."
When they opened the strong-room they let a group of five strangers enter and had them (re-)seal; and they themselves sealed together with them.
Since they opened the sealings of Aššur-ṭāb and Aššur-ṣulūlī we became afraid for your sake, so we have not reopened the strong-room.
We wrote to ask your advice; the very day you hear our letter you should send us word, and then we shall open the strong-room.
The servants must not be delayed.

3 packages: 55 minas under the seal of Pūšu-kēn, his charges paid, 1 package 15 minas silver under his large seal, the ikribum-offering of Aššur, 1 supānum-container: 50 shekels silver its consignment, 10 minas wool (in) 2 leather sacks, a net(?), all this I entrusted to Agua.
Witnesses: Šumma-libbi-Aššur son of Kuzkzum, Ikuppi-Aššur son of Puzur-Ištar, Šalim-Aššur son of Itūr-ilī.
5 shekels silver (for) the provisions of the 'boys'and their head-tax paid.
Out of the 80 minas, the share of our father, plus the 80 minas of copper, the share of Aššur-nādā--at the rate in silver of 15 shekels per (talent)--plus
When there was an opportunity to invest 20
When there was an opportunity (to invest) 15 kutānu-textiles, Aššur-nādā deposited 1 1/2 kutānu-textile; the limmu-officials were Amur-Ištar and Ilabrat-bāni.
3 shekels of silver for the 5 percent tax on textiles in Burušhaddum; 4 shekels of silver for the tithe in Kaneš has been booked for Aššur-taklāku in Kaneš,
Witnesses: Ilī-dān, Kuzīya, ..., Taqin-aššur
Ikūppī-Aššur owes Pūšu-kēn x minas refined silver.
You took the 1 mina refined silver and 15 shekels of "refined of its echange"? belonging to Abuna.
Abuna took(?) The silver and its interest in your name?
Mawašhi owes 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver to Aššur-nādā.
She will pay before harvest from the ḫamuštum week of Naram-Suen.
If she does not paid (in time), she will add interest at the rate 3 shekels per month per mina.
Witnessed by Mezini, witnessed by Šarmama, witnessed by Halitka, witnessed by Kušuman.
Seal of Mezini, seal of Šarma'i, seal of Halitka, seal of Kušuman seal of Mawašhi.

Concerning 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver (which) Mawašhi owes to Aššur-nādā--reckoned from the week of Narām-Sīn she must pay before harvest; if she has not paid she must add interest at the rate 3 shekels per month per mina.
... Pūšu-kēn ...
In all [PN] brought 42 1/3 minas silver for you.
18 minas silver, its excise added, its shipping charges satisfied under my seal and the seal of Lālum, Kurub-Ištar brings to you.
Lālum sealed in place of Lā-qēpum.
In total, he will (bring?) to you 2 talents 27 minas 8 shekels silver after I come.
Seal the exchange goods with Lā-qēpum's seals and clear it.
Let me send it to you.
From the silver out on credit ...
Also, he will carry (back) your textiles.
After I ... (arrive-ish)? (at) Durḫumit, I will send word to you. ???
If anyone ... for/to ... I will come to an agreement ...
To Pūšu-kēn from Adad-bāni:
I siezed Ennam-Aššur and I said to him, "The silver as much as you promised to the man saying, 'We will indeed bring the silver to the man.'"

He said, "Do not worry for another 10 days. Let me settle accounts with my brother so that he sends me my copper so that I may answer the share of Ḫinnaya and the representatives of Dān-Aššur and fulfill it from my own funds."
I said, "At your departure(!) either 5 minas of silver or about 10 talents of silver we will weigh out to the representatives of my investor/principal.
"Why would I write to my principal?"
He said, "About 20 minas of silver, the amount which I promised him, I will go and I will pay."
I said, "Let me write to my principal that you will acquire the silver."
He said, "I will acquire it, write (to him)."
I wait for this ???
As for the copper about which you wrote the merchant, 10 1/2 talents of fine copper were placed in the house of Amur-Ištar.
Aššuriš-tikal took possession of it and he said, "I will depart on my journey in two days."
Ennam-Aššur son of Šū-Aššur brought 30 minas silver, its excise added, its transport tariff paid, in totla 31 minas 45 shekels.
Aššur-mālik son of Erraya brought you 20 mians silver, its excise added, its transport tarrif paid, in total 20 minas 10 shekels silver.
30 minas silver, its excise added, its transport tarriff paid, and 2 minas separately the silver exchanged for the 6 kutānum textiles of Dān-Aššur ... your silver ... (Dān-Aššur brought to you)
Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn:

6 talents 30 minas tin under my seal, 18 šurum textiles as wrappings, 100 kutānum textiles, 7 black donkeys, 1 talent 10 minas tin for their expenses: all this under my seal Sū-Suen and Dān-Aššur transport to you.
From the 10 textiles of Dān-Aššur, give 1 šurum textile to the lady.
Sell my tin and textiles to a reliable merchant, as reliable as yourselves on "short" term credit.
If (a credit sale) on short terms is not available, when you sell on credit, sell my tin and textiles to a reliable merchant, as reliable as yourselves.
Your merchant must be reliable.
Do not overvalue a month or two.
Write in your tablet as much silver as you give to the merchant and the term period.
Two sacks --14 minas tin -- (related) to Agua, 6 kutānum textiles separately for merchants: all this Šū-Suen and Dān-Aššur bring to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn.
Bundle Dān-Aššur's black donkeys and textiles with the black donkeys and sell (them) on 'short' terms.
Have the silver paid at his (Dān-Aššur's) departure so that he brings it in his transport.
To Pūšu-kēn from Aḫu-waqar, Puzur-Aššur and Dān-Aššur:
You wrote. You said, "Purchase 33 minas silver worth of tin for me."
Let the open country (overland journey) seize it!
Cheap or dear, there is was no tin to be had at his departure.
The 17 minas which Ilī-mālik brought is available under his seal.
At the arrival of tin we will purchase tin for you according to your instructions.
We will send it to you with the express caravan.
The excise and shipping fees were deducted and we received 7 minas 32 shekels silver from Gazia, and we will pay out the silver which they received.
We paid out 27 shekels silver interest from your silver.
The raqqutum-textile about which you wrote, is not available.
From Aššur-idī to Alāhum, Elamma, Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-taklāku:
My dear brothers, for 30 years I have been living in the City and I always pay the accounts.
Appeal to the colony authorities and ask for clemency for me from the colony, so that for the silver I may deposit 3 shekels per mina.
If they do not agree with you, then implore them that I may stand only for half a share of a man.
Are you not aware which are my deposits?
Should I make another deposit on top of that?
I have paid 37 minas on the account!
Do me this favor.
Take care to have me stand only for half a share of a man.
Send me word whether this is so or not as soon as possible.
Together with my other silver I left 4 1/2 minas belonging to Kurub-Ištar as an outstanding claim with you.
Have it paid and send it to me.
From Ḫinnaya to Qarwiya, Pūšu-kēn, and Aššur-dān:
To Qarwiya and Aššur-dān:
You wrote me.
You said, "We asked Aššur-nādā and the son of Elama for the silver. They said, 'Wherever silver here to Durḫumit we arrive and we will send the silver and seal it and send it to him.'"
After you wrote to me, third year for the taking of the silver -- should Aššur-dān go after after them and he casued them to pay. ???
Bad or good, who in Kaneš will do anything on my behalf?
Now, you wrote me regarding the 15 1/2 minas silver which Elama promised to pay to Lā-qēpum.
You said, "The representative of Elama said, 'Let him bring out his witnesses so that he can take his silver.'"
Of the third my witness tablet at the gate of the gods you did not take!
For the 20 minas silver which I gave to him or at the gate of the Alaḫḫinum, I will not prosecute him in the presence of Aššur-mālik son of Al-āḫum.
I said, "Take heed to send me the silver quickly!"
Why is it that your full message has not come nor have you sent the silver of my tin?
To Aššur-nādā and Ištar-pilah from Kuzallum:
When the scribe Kura came in order to levy the transport tariff, after they imposed the tax on what I had sent here, for the merchandise that came with Ištar-pilah . . .
silver . . .
. . . to the colony . . .
. . . to you . . .

on the merchandise in Ištar-pilah's caravan, since the transport tariff had already been levied, then, my dear father and lords, confront the colony there in order that I do not have to pay transport tariff a second time.
(Specifically) to Aššur-nādā:
Did you not personally observe here that they levied the tax?
Check the merchandise in accordance with the memorandum I gave you in Tišmurna.
From Aššur-nādā to Pūšu-kēn, Itūr-Ilī, and Ennam-Aššur:
Concerning the silver, the price of your house, and the house of Dalaš, the city rendered a verdict that the merchants of the house of Dalaš are rapš.

Now after Dalaš died, anyone of the merchants who took silver, maid, servant or consumable grain or anything, will return and will rpš before the dagger of Aššūr and stand for the 'gate' of the your(pl.) silver.
If merchants who took silver after the death of Dalaš return, the you(pl.) must return the price of the houses and take an oath, and stand for the 'gate'of my silver and send it to me.
If they who took (silver after the death of Dalaš) do not return, then you (pl.) do not return even a single shekel.
Let Pūšu-kēn pay so that you seal and send to me so that anyone who ther is(?) may ešu to me.

Let you rmessage come stating whoever it was who took the silver from the caravan of Aššūr-mālik, my kšdt, and 3 minas silver from the caravan of Buṣiya which they promised to pay,-- kutanina-ma(???).
To Pūšu-kēn:
My dear brother, the terms of the silver they mtd(?).
Seal the silver and send it to me.
Do not disappoint me.
From Pūšu-kēn to Lamassī:
The remainder of your previous textiles are exhausted to you.
As for the 20 textiles which you gave to Puzur-Aššur, 1 textiles was for the excise and 2 for the purchases, and I received 17 textiles.
Aḫu-waqar brought 6 textiles.
Ea-šar brought 6 textiles.
Idī-Suen brought 2 textiles.
Thereof, I added 3 textiles to Puzur-Aššur and I entrusted 20 textiles to him and I gave them to his account.
The remainder of your textiles, 11 textiles, I owe you.
Thereof 1 1 /2 minas silver, the excise added and shipping satisfied, Kulumaya brings to you under my seal.
You wrote me, "From the tetiles which I sent to you, 2 textiles of Šupūltum and the silver which (you said) Kulumaya brings to you, 1 mina silver kuwaʾum, give a half mina to Šu-ūltum."

The price of 1 heavy textile which Šupūltum brought me from Purušḫattum and 7 shekels silver which Ili-bāni, which the son of Kusārum paid to me, and from teh remainder of the revenues of your textiles I will seize the silver and I will send it to you with Idī-Suen.
To Lamassi:
Give 5 fine textiles to each of the youth.
Let them bring them.
Let them reach me.
Why is it that you have worried about the maḫā'um? Here, I myself will concern myself with what they said about your bread rations.
Innaya will enter and leave.
Seals: Puzur-šadūʾē son of Tuimum, Kuzīya son of ..., PN son of x-x-zi.
Pūšu-kēn gave 1/3 mina refined silver to Kuzīya as capital.
Pūšu-kēn gave 1/3 mina refined silver to Kuziya as capital.
Witness: Puzur-sadu'e son of MAŠ.
Seals: Ṭāb-šill-Aššur s. Daki..., PN s. Agiaya, Šāt-Ea d. Suetata.
Šāt-Ea owes Pūšu-kēn 12 shekels silver.
She will pay 5 ḫamuštum-weeks from the ḫamuštum-week of Aššur-taklāku.
If (she) does not pay, she will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month interest.
Pūšu-kēn received 13 minas 10 shekels tin, the excise for 8 talents tin.
Pūšu-kēn (also?) (received??) 28 shekels silver, the price of a donkey.
From Aššur-imittī, Erra-il, and Aššur-bāni to Pūšu-kēn and PN:

5/6 shekels for the taxed textiles,
7 1/2 shekels for the exit tax--.
Altogether Šumī-abiya brings you goods worth 15 minas 3 1/3 shekels silver.
The remainder of the (goods yeilded from the) silver will come to you in the transport of Mannum-bālum-Aššūr.
To Aššur-dān and Agua from Pūšu-kēn:
To Aššur-dān:

x minas silver (with) the representative of Aššur-rē'ī, x minas (silver with) the representative of Iliš-tīkal, x minas (silver with) Lālum, x minas (silver with) Gazia, 1 mina (silver for PN), the losses of the brother of Qarwiya ...
Purchase a very fine table with the 1/2 mina silver, the price of the raqqutum textile you owe.
Sell(?) it when I write my youth.
If you did not give (him it), I will not grant you the parsum and interest as a favor.
Ištar-pilaḫ, the priest of Aššur owes me 35 shekels silver.
His tablet is with my (servant/youth?).
His term is exceeded by a year.
... my instructions will come to you.
The remainder of the silver ...
To Šalim-aḫum from Pūšu-kēn:
I paid out (another) mina later.
I paid out 2 minas to the son of Idī-Ištar.
I paid out 3 minas 15 shekels to the representative of Puzur-Anna.
5 shekels toward the 15 shekels for your packerare settled.
I paid 3 shekels for the smuggled goods-your robes.
Altogether 1 talent 22 minas silver, your assessment, 1 mina 22 shekels ...  son ... 1 1/3 .....
From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-imittī s. Ikūn-piya:
To Aššur-imittī:
1 talent 5 minas tin under my seal and 2 black textiles ... mine (PN carries/d to you?)
As for you and PN, [approach/sieze] Šu-Aššur s. Al-aḫum.
My dear brothers, Take ... there from the silver of Šū-Aššur pertaining to my tin and textiles, and seal it and send it immediately.
Urgent, take care to do it!
Seal(s!) of Ennam-Suen s. Aššur-mālik, Aššur-lā-qēpum s. Aššur-mālik and Šamaš-damiq s. Aššur-mālik.
From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn:
Regarding Ikūnum about whom you wrote: Here I will acquire an attorney over his 'thirds' in the land and with the next traveller I will write to you.
As for the silver that you sent, we did not purchase tin because tin cannot be purchased.
We purchased textiles from the proceeds of my silver and I will dispatch them to you with the first departure.
Hoard every 10 minas tin which goes up to you into your tin.
There won't be tin later.
Regarding the matter of the son of Qayyātum, who are you that you did not write me this concerning the matters (??)
I heard that the man is able to speak and he owes about 30 minas silver to Aššūr-Šamšī his brother and his sealed tablet is there.
Inquire and let your complete instructions come.
He will pay x months (from) the month of Ab šarrānē.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/2 shekel per 10 shekels (as interest).
Ilī-nādā owes Šalim-Anum x shekels silver.
Enli-bāni s. Ilī-bāni owes Imdi-ilum 10 mina refined silver.
He will pay 60 weeks from the ḫamštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim s. Panaka and Aššur-ṭāb s. Qarwiya
If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest.
Witnesses: Enna-Bēlim s. Šū-Laban, Uṣur-ša-Ištar s. Aššur-imittī.
Idī-abim s. Idī-Ištar owes Aššur-imittī and Imdi-ilum 22 1/2 minas silver.
He will pay 55 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-taklāku and Itūr-ilī.
If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels.
Month: Ṣip'um.
Year: [broken].

Ušur-ša-Ištar owes 34 (1/2?) shekels silver.

Thereof, the 'third' of the caravan of Ennam-Anum is with/owed by Imdi-ilum.
Ištar-pilaḫ s. Anninum owes 1 mina 23 3/4 shekels silver.
He will pay at the time of his departure.
Witnesses: Aḫ-šila his transporter, Aššur-dān s. Ikuppiya, Iddin-Adad s. Ṣilli-Adad.
I gave your representatives' tin to Aššur-nādā s. Aššur-idī.
Kuzizīya owes Imdi-ilum 21 shekels extremely fine
He will pay 13 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Pūšu-kēn and Kurub-Ištar.
If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1/2 shekels.
Month: Kuzallu.
Year: Al-aḫum s. Inaḫ-ilum.
Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn, Ḫuraṣānum s. Šū-Anum, Aššur-rē'ī s. Idīda.
Imdi-ilum gave Iddin-Aššur 1 mina silver.
He will pay promptly at his coming up to Kanesh.
Witnesses: Enlil-bāni s. Ilī-bāni, Amur-ilī s. Ibbī-Suen.
I gave 1/2 mina refined silver to Ennam-Aššur s. Šalim-aḫum.
Dān-Aššur will pay me the silver.
He (Imdi-ilum?) gave it as a capital loan (be'alum).
They will pay x ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Enna-Bēlum and Aššur-ṣulūlī.
If they do not pay (on time) they will add x shekels (as interest).
Nūr-kī-ilī owes 2 minas silver.
Witnesses: Aššur-ṭāb s. Kikki, Dadaya s. Aššur-imittī
Becasue I kept depositing(?) you and there was not another caravan, we were unable to settle the matter at the palace.
I will pay 1 mina silver to you (pl) and Šū-Anum and Nakiled will bring it to you.
I will settle with you.
Here ...
To
From Ilabrat-bāni to Amur-ilī:
You wrote me.
In Purušḫaddum I consigned the textiles on terms of 10 weeks to an agent, and his term is now up.
One month ago I sent a servant to Uṣur-ša-Aššur in Purušḫaddum.
When he has made the agent pay the money I will send it to you.
Also, I entrusted (the textiles) to the agent with Uṣur-ša-Aššur as witness.
Ask him there yourself!
As you are my brother and friend, send me the small things that were booked for you in my tablet as well as textiles for my own clothing.
I live here without any textiles.
I am dressed ... in his garment ... ?
x-x-ni-Aššur is the ... ?
I hear that you are going on a trip to Durḫumit.
Urgent, take care to get the first tin and textiles which they carry at the gate there before anyone else and thus raise an extra mina or two of silver.
As you are my brother, send me a good belt for my waist.
I am fitted out with a wrap on my waist.
To Aššur-bēl-awātim, Alāhum's and Alili's representatives, Hinnaya and Aššur-nādā from Aššur-bēl-malkim:

About the silver of my working capital, which you sent to the City, Alāhum, Aššur-idī and Alili met concerning it, and they gave me 2 talents of tin under seal, 8 textiles (and) 8 minas of tin for expenses.
In the city gate they made a public statement, saying: ''Now, Uṣur-ša-Aššur is our representative."
Uṣur-ša-Aššur was held back in the City while I left for Uršu with my own enterprise.
A message from Šū-Kūbum reached me at Uršu and in Šū-Kūbum's message (it said): "Convert the tin to  textiles!"
Since the textiles had been set aside, I converted the tin to 4 talents of [copper].
My merchandise is scattered around; I shall collect it and arrive at the beginning of spring.
To Aššur-bēl-awātim, the representatives of Alāhum (and) Alili, Hinnaya and Aššur-nādā.
Seal of Aššur-bēl-malkim.
According to the decision of the plenary assembly of the Kanesh colony, Ennum-Aššur questioned Suen-nādā.
Thus said Suen-nādā to Ennum-Aššur:

I and my servant girl were staying in Kanesh and you went to Durḫumit and acted as though you had authority concerning things that were not owed to you by entering into my guesthouse and pulling out objects and two of my sealed boxes.
Seals: Azu'u s. Puzur-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni s. Aššur-mālik.
Dadaya s. Nimar-Ištar was our partner.
Seals: Dān-Aššur, Aššur-mālik s. Ilī-bāni, Issu-rīk, Elāli s. Iddin-Aššur, Šū-Kūbum.
Regarding the 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels gold, Šū-Kūbum took if on behalf of his mother and brother and on behalf of himself, from/with? Idī-Ištar.
For the 1/3 mina 2 1/2 shekels of silver, the working capital of Šamaš-tappā'ī  Kurub-Ištar will sue him.
If Šamaš-tappā'ī and Ilum-malik have sold (their working capitals), they will discuss with their witnesses.
Nannia, Katātum and Uṣup-iškum, these men are the judges.
Seal of Nannia son of Haya seal of Katātum son of Aššur-imittī, seal of Uṣup-iškum son of Šū-Anum; these men are the judges.
Ilī-ašranni and Šamaš-tappā'ī owe 1 1/2 mina of silver to Aššur-nādā reckoned from the week of Šū-Illil and Elāli they will add interest at the rate 2 1/2 shekels per month
He holds a bundle of gold under their seals as collateral security.
Witnessed by Iddin-abum, witnessed by Ilabrat-bāni.
Seal of Iddin-abum, seal of Ilī-ašranni, seal of Šamaš-tappā'ī, seal of Ilabrat-bāni.
Concerning the debt of Ilī-ašranni and Šamaš-tappā'ī; concerning 1 1/2 mina of silver; reckoned from the week of Šū-Illil and Elāli they will add interest at the rate 2 1/2 shekel per month per mina.
A bundle of gold has been deposited as collateral security.
They will pay in pure silver.
Tammuriya and Išpunuman owe Aššur-idī 6 minas silver.

Regarding the 9 2/3 minas of refined silver which Karria has given to Aššur-nādā as an investment loan--the merchandise has arrived up here from the City, and Aššur-ṭāb has taken (his share of) the merchandise corresponding to this amount in silver.
If anybody should raise a claim against Aššur-nādā, Aššur-ṭāb will clear him.
Witnessed by Aššur-dān, witnessed by Imdī-ilum, witnessed by Buzia.
Seal of Aššur-dān, seal of Buzia, seal of Imdī-ilum, seal of Aššur-ṭāb.

Concerning the 9 2/3 minas of refined silver which Karria gave to Aššur-nādā as an investment loan: The silver and the purchases made with it has left the City, and Aššur-ṭāb has taken his merchandise.
Should anyone raise a claim against Aššur-nādā, Aššur-ṭāb will clear him.

From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā:
Alulaya's son gave me his word here, saying:
"As soon as I arrive I shall send you 6 minas of silver."
1 mina of silver is owed by Puzur-Ištar's son, and take care to send Zuzu's silver as well as what he borrowed from you as soon as possible.
From Aššur-idī to Assur-nādā:

As to the 5 kutinnum textiles belonging to Aššur-bēl-awātim which were sealed with Aššur-imittī's seal, and which cost 13 minas (of copper) a piece in the City, give him 2 minas 5 shekels refined silver as their equivalent value when he is about to leave on a trip to the City.
To Aššur-nādā from Aššur-taklāku:
5 talents of wool for each of you, representing 300 fleeces, I received as your shares.
1 mina 10 shekels of silver will be deducted from each of your shares.
31 1/2 hides or 40 minas (of wool) for each mina of silver (invested) resulted from Pūšu-kēn's enterprise, so I received 10 talents 50 minas of wool representing 600 fleeces.
Even at the rate 1 1/6 shekel for (a mina of) wool there is no silver to be had, although the fleeces are in order.

As to the matter of appealing to the colony authorities, about which you have written so often, at least ten times, I approached Alāhum and Kurub-Ištar, but it was not the right moment to appeal on your behalf.
Buzutaya has confirmed to me the silver which I balanced with him.
The time for the accounting is close.
You had been told by me by letter to leave, so, come and let them divide (the assets) in accordance with the note.
To Alāhum Aššur-nādā and Iddin-Suen from Ilī-ālum:
I hear that Kuzāzum's merchandise has come up here.
My dear fathers, have the silver paid.
It is 4 minas plus furthermore 1 mina 6 shekels of refined silver, reckoned from the beginning of the month Qarra' atum, (on which) he will pay interest at the rate 3 shekels per mina per month;
Eponym Sudaya, the son of Ennānum.
Have the silver and its interest paid.
Do our father and me (this) favour.
If his merchandise does not suffice to cover the silver and the interest, then take what there is to take, and let him add interest on the rest at the rate of 3 shekels per mina.
To Aššur-nādā from Iddin-Ištar:
since the land of Burušhaddum as well as Wahšušana is in revolt, for that reason I did not proceed to Wahšušana,and I took no decision about the copper that is stored in Wahšušana.
Within 5 days I shall hear definitive news, and shall proceed to Wahšušana.
Aššur-šamši is on his way to you with x minas of washed copper under my seal.
Pay Alāhum's silver
and buy for the rest of the silver kusītu-textiles from Mamma as well as menuni'ānu textiles and woolly fleeces,
fill up the donkeys so empty donkeys will not come here.
Take care to get a tablet with their testimony as witnesses and send it to me as soon as possible.
To Imdī-ilum, Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-ṣulūlī from Aššur-mālik, Azu and Idī-Adad:
Adad-pilaḫ brought 1 talent 40 minas of tin.
At a 6 shekel rate, their silver is 3 minas 44 1/2 shekels.
The copper was sold for 56 shekels of silver.
Three garments were sold for ... .
In total, your silver ...
... this ... for (?) silver (?) ...
Also, to me Ikūppiya owes 3 1/2 minas of silver.
The colony will take 220 minas of copper.
The price of the raqqutum textile was .. silver.
From the textiles of the boy, and(?) ..., 2 raqqutum textiles and ... and 1 mṭt garment are available.
Amur-Ištar brings you lapis under seal belonging to Azu.
Why is it that he did not leave the sealed tablet of the merchant here?
... here ... owes to him(?) ...
From Hinnaya to Aššur-nādā, Dān-Aššur and Hadāni:
1 talent 20 minas of tin for expenses plus 11 2/3 minas of tin under seal for Aššur-šamšī, 1 mina 5 shekels of tin, his own--
in all 1 1/2 talent 1 2/3 mina of tin;
240 textiles, except those belonging to Aššur-bēl-awātim, my packer;
I gave them 13 2/3 minas of silver for either scrap metal or small wares;
further, I gave them 1 shekel of silver for small wares just before the departure;
they gave 10 minas of nails, 136 in number, for the carriage of 10 top-packs and 4 half-packs, and I personally paid the transportation costs until Qaṭṭara;
11 black donkeys-all this I entrusted to Hadāni.
The total value of the shipment: 13 1/2 talents.
Let them deduct the fees and send the proceeds from the sale of the tin and textiles to my representatives.
Also, do not release as many textiles as may belong to Aššur-bēl-awātim and Huzzia or to the packers;
but send my ... to my representatives, either by smuggling or (paying) import duty.
Give (them) their food and their...
My dear brothers, take care to stand by...
when my merchandise enters the palace and entrust it to be sent to Ištar-pilah, Aššur-šamšī and Aššuriš-takil;
then have them entrust to you as much as I have given to them to dispose over.

If they permit šitapku-deposits in the colony office of either textiles or silver, then you must make deposits, and then write to Ištar-pilah how much you will deposit as my share so he can send you as much silver as you have deposited as my share.
Read the letter, seal it and send it to Ištar-pilah.
Seal of Amurrum-bāni son of Manana, seal of Puzur-saduʾē son of MAŠ, seal of Uṣur-ša-Aššur son of Aššur-mālik, seal of Ilabrat-bāni son of Aššur-mālik, seal of Idī-Ištar son of Aššur-mālik.
Ušur-ša-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni and Idī-Ištar, sons of Aššur-mālik owe Pūšu-kēn 7 minas silver.
When Pūšu-kēn gives accounts in the city to his investors, it will be deducted from the dividend of Aššur-mālik, from the shares of Ušur-ša-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni,  and Idī-Ištar.
The silver, while he has claim on it, is bound in the city.
And it is bound to the heads of their selves.
In (exchange for) this silver, I gave them the tablet stating 12 1/3 minas silver and its interst--the debt of Uṣur-ša-Aššur.

Make what can be made and send it to me, great or small.
From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā:
I shall negotiate with my shareholders.
Do not send me any silver.
Within 5 days after this (negotiation) I shall send you word.
If anyone should seize you, saying:
"Inform me of your father's silver!"
well, when the City has judged me, then I shall inform you.

1/2 mina of refined silver, its import duty added, its transport tariff paid, for Šarrat-Ištar;
5 10 shekels of refined silver from my votive offerings;

To Aššur-nādā from Pilah-Ištar:
Agua, Ṭāb-pī-Anum and Ilī-bāni released me from Badna, and Ṭāb-pī-Anum said:
"Come on, together with us."
They were waiting for textiles.
We left Badna together during the night but they did not allow me into the guest-house together with them.
Alone I spent the night in a cow-stable.
They broke into the house and removed 6 textiles.
I poured dust on my head (in despair) for your sake, and I returned to Badna to Alābum;
then (officers of) the trading station at Badna went up to the barullu-officers (of the palace) and said:
"Let us search (for the textiles), and if they are lost then we shall personally give compensation."
The plenary assembly at Waḫšušana permitted us, and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur.
Sabasiya is our partner.
3 minas silver is with Amur-Aššur which was for accounting.
1 mina 1/2 shekel and also its tablet stating 2 minas silver and 25 sacks of barley of the debt of Warḫila.
2 minas silver is owed by Nakiled.
45 shekels silver is owed by Azu, his son, and his brother.
45 shekels (silver) is owed by the palace of Ḫattum.
1/2 mina silver, the beʾulātum loan of Adad-bāni's son, is with Dudu.
Aššur-iddin s. Šu-Ištar took 1/2 mina silver, the beʾulātum loand of Šamaš-taklāku.
1 mina 50 shekels silver is owed by Wawali and Aššur-imittī.
From Aššur-mutabbil to Kunania:
Purchase 1/2 a sila of kamūne, ... for the child and rise up and come here.
and get up
and come here.
Kura owes Itūr-ilī 1 mina refined silver.
He will pay 10 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Pilaḫ-Aššur s. Kasasa, month of Ab šarrānē, eponymate of Ilšu-rabi.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).
Witnesses: Ilī-nādā, Amur-Aššur, Banaga.
Dadīya s. Nanabum owes Aššur-mālik s. Enna-Suen s. Sukkallīya 18 1/2 shekels refined silver.
He will pay in five months.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of 1 shekel (per mina) per month.
Ṣeḫr-ilī s. Aššur-emūqī s. Qaqqadānum owes Amur-ilī s. i-nu-ba-a 1 mina 35 1/3 shekels refined silver.
He will pay 47 2/3 shekels refined silver thirteen weeks from the ḫamuštum of Lilušum, month of Tanwarta, Eponymate of Āl-ṭāb s. Pilaḫ-Aššur.
He will pay 47 2/3 shekels in twenty weeks.
If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add x shekels (per mina per month) as interest.
Biradi owes Aššur-rabi 14 shekels silver.
He will pay 10 weeks from the of Aššur-mālik and Enna-Suen.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add the colony rate as interest.
If he leaves town (lit. stretches out the road) before his term, he will deduct the silver from his sustenance allowance.
Wintesses: Aššur-rabi, Puzur-Aššur.
20 kutānu-textiles and 1 pirikannu-textile Pithala and Watkam are bringing to you.
Here Nannaya, the son of Ikuhlum, entrusted it to them.
Give them each 1 1/3 shekel of silver as wages.
Then you must mark the hems of the textiles, acting as my representatives.
If you know the men, then question the men from Timelkia there, the earlier messengers who stay there.
If this letter catches up with Šalim-Adad, then seal 5 minas of tiri silver from my stocks of silver, that he may bring it here.
Šalim-Adad must not stay for a single night, but send him.
Ilī-ālum and Inar should come together with him.
If Šalim-Adad has already left or is unwilling to come, then give the 5 minas of silver to a trustworthy affiliated trader, so he may bring it.
If there is no affiliated trader, then give 2 minas of silver to Ilī-ālum, and let him be bound by a contract in Kaneš, so that Inar and he may come overland.
Do give Ilī-ālum instructions there!
In accordance with the tablet of the colony authorities you should not worry for ten days, i.e. until we receive (a decision in) our case from the palace.
Here Šū-Kūbum' s representatives appealed to the colony, saying: "Aššur-nādā is not ready for the accounting."
Šū-Kūbum is indeed their attorney; that is why we have made inquiries and have appointed you to answer for it all at the accounting.
We gave 6
According to the order of the City, who evades the accounting shall pay the debt of the colony.
To Alāhum, Šū-Aššur, Zuba and Ilī-alum from Aššur-nādā:
Haluli became indebted to me for 3 minas of silver from Šalahšua, but he has given me a corresponding amount.
From Aššur-nādā to Aguza, Uṣur-ša-Aššur and Šišahšušar:
7 shekels of refined silver Kuziziya borrowed from me 8 years ago.
When I stayed there I seized him, but he said: ''My  merchandise has not arrived yet."
My dear brothers, seize him and make him pay the silver and as much interest as is fitting.
Do not show him any favours!
Give it to the maid.
Buy two leather pouches, load a donkey with oil, and send it to me.
Do send as much as both can contain.
From Aššur-nādā to Iddin-Suen and Šišahšušar:
Kuzuziya has owed me 17 shekels of refined silver, the price of an abarniu-textile, for 10 years.
How come that when the maid went, he insulted her?
The profit accrued on my silver, over which he has disposed for 10 years, make him pay that silver, and give it to the maid.
If he protests in any way, then let him swear by divine Aššur' s
Please, do not show him any favour.
Either he pays the silver or you make him take an oath!
15 shekels of silver is owed by Hartal.
His tin was pledged for it.
Make him pay the silver and have paid x mina 6 shekels of silver belonging to Dudu (and) 1/2 mina owed by Šarapunuwa, and give it to the maid(?).
From Kurub-Ištar to Aššur-nādā:
Send me word about how many textiles and how much tin and what tablets concerning commission agents of Iṣmid-ilum they have entrusted to you.
Inform me; then write to Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur, saying: "He is on his way to you with 60 extra-fine kutānu-textiles plus 6 abarniu-textiles."
You should either leave yourself to come to me or send Kura, so I may entrust the textiles plus the rest of the tin and the donkeys to him.
They have imposed on 20 minas of silver expenses imposed by the City on your enterprise.
Write there to Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur that he should send to you whatever silver will accrue to you for the value of your shipment.
I shall place 12 1/2 shekels of silver within the saddle.
From Hinnaya to Aššur-nādā:
As to the silver I gave to you, whatever purchase you make, be it tin or textiles, whatever you buy give that to Šū-Kūbum so he may bring it.
If Šū-Kūbum has already left, then give it to the first caravan so it may bring it.
From Āl-ilī, Ikūn-pīya and Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn, Imdī-ilum and Kurub-Ištar:
To Kurub-Ištar:
Who are you to Aššūr-imittī that you took 2 minas of silver belonging to Imlikaya?
Now, your tablet of the house of Aššur-rēʾī which states 2 minas 15 shekels as your debt, pay the debt and its interest!
And as for the 2 minas silver of Imlikaya which you seized, pay it out!

To P
My dear brothers, hd' to the inventory of Abī-anum.
At your departure, balance my account so that we give 1 minas 7 shekels silver from your account.
Also, take the weapon of Abī-anum and so take the silver he owes to.
From Šū-Ḫubur and the sons of Aššur-imittī to Buzutaya, Pūšu-kēn and Imdī-ilum:
If you come to an agreement there and the man is well, then the man must not harm our father's house.
As much as you are able, lean on him for the silver from the goods so that the silver is bound in the city.
If it is not so, clear the man of it (the obligation).
We keep hearing that the man is ill.
Take care to clear him.
15 minas tin, separately, that are in the midst of his goods, are my ikrībū-funds.
When his house deposited his goods, Aššu-rēʾī, Ḫannunum, and Aššur-imittī son of Ikuwa gave to him 5 minas tin.
Have him pay the price of my tin.
From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn:
Kurara and Idī-Aššur brought to you 22 kutānum-textiles, 1 black donkey.
Idī-Aššur sent to you 1 talent 5 minas tin and you sent 9 2/3 minas silver and then it was lost.

If you are my brother, absorb (some of the loss) and send whatever silver can be sent from your own funds and concerning the textiles (that are) the  ikrībū  ššūr, extend yourself for one mina per mina (extra) and thus give (me) encouragement.
You did not send about 2 minas silver to Šalim-Aššur and Aššūr-bāni at your departure.
To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-mālik:
Uzua son of Idī-Aššur brings you 6 minas lapis in stone block form under my seal.
My dear father and lord, sell it to merchants or to anyone you can and cause the silver to come to the city for me.
Should I keep it in Haka and I would keep the yeild.
But its not silver.
If you would send it to Purušḫattum and send me 5 minas silver as exchange from your own funds, you yourself can keep the yeild of the stone.
So let me owe you a favor for sending me 5 minas silver from your own funds.
To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-imittī, Tariš-mātum, and Bēlātum:
Puzur-Aššūr brought 20 minas silver.
Thereof, 175 kutānum-textiles were worth 16 minas 53 shekels silver.
30 minas hand tin, at a rate of 13 shekels (per shekel silver), its silver was 3 minas 18 1/2 shekels.
6 black donkeys, they cost 2 minas silver.
The gear of the donkey was 19 shekels.
Puzur-Aššur took additional costs amounting to 20 shekels silver.
Il-bāni took 20 shekels silver.
Let him return it there (?)
Išar-bēlī took 12 shekels.
Let him return it there (?)
27 shekels, the beʾulātum of Belili, 19 shekels ... zi-tum.
From these goods 213 kutānum-textiles, 2 donkeys, and their gear, Agua son of Puzur-Aššūr will bring to you.
Puzur-Aššur brings to you 52 kutānum-textiles and 2 donkeys and their gear.
silver ... if ... weigh out as a favor to the house of our father.
Take care to send the silver which is there and that which arises to you from the merchandise.
Do not release the silver to the accounts of the sons of Aššur-mālik.
We received the silver of Al-aḫum but the debt which Aššur-mālik fulfilled he did not riḫ whatsoever.
To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum:
Concerning the silver of the votive fund, here you saddened Bēlātum.
From the utensils and that among the eṭṭamē, ...
Our dear father and lord, do not release the silver to the youths.
Concerning the mazzāzum the god will do something evil to our fathers's house.
Urgent, if you are our father, gather together as much as you can, and place your name on it so that the youth(s) can in this make a claim against the votive funds.
Urgent, none of the youth should ... nor take a single shekel of silver.
We heard that Išār-bēlī brought you 1 donkey and Uṣur-ša-Aššur departed.
He must not mṣi nor take a single shekel!
If Išār-bēlī had not yet arrived, send word so that whatever goods you own enter before him  from the donkeys.
When the textilesare sold, seal and send the silver so that ... altogether ....
Our dear father, without you we have no one.
To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum:
The daughters of Puzur-Ištar and Uṣur-ša-Aššur are ill and seem as though they are dying!
We went to the diviners and thus says the god: "You do not respect the votive offerings. ... them."
We are preparing for the harvest!
Ask the youth whether he(?) will ... or not and let your message come so that we can ... them.
Either the price of the tin or of the textiles, seal the silver and send it here.
The ten textiles which we gave to the attorney, have the silver paid and send it here.
We gave 1 textile to Aššur-imittī and Šū-Ištar and the sent it to you in the caravan of Innāya (and) Idī-Suen.
We requested silver of Šū-Išrat and he said, "Idī-Suen gave that textile to Pūšu-kēn."
Send here the silver, the yeild of the one textile.
To Pūšu-kēn from Asqudum:
Šamaš-bāni your transporter brings you 3 1/2 minas silver.
My dear father and lord, do you not constantly hear?

I acted on your behalf.

I will come with the next travelers.
To Pūšu-kēn from Ikūnum:
1/3 mina refined silver - Šū-Ištar, 1/2 mina silver and its excise - Adad-bāni--they promised to pay at their arrival.

Enna-Suen brought 13

From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn:
From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn:

In addition to the 5 minas silver about which I wrote to Ilabrat-bāni, you also add 10 minas from my silver and declare the silver and as much gold and you can carry and declare it in the awītum assessment as my votive funds so that it does not accrue shipping charges in the caravan.
6 shekels gold from Panaka. 7 shekels from Ḫuraṣānum, make him pay at his arrival.

From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn:

The tablet of instructions which I wrote to Aššur-mālik and Ḫinnaya, if Aššur-mālik arrived in Kanesh and if Ḫinnaya has not yet arrived in Kanesh, seize the representatives of Aššur-mālik and the representatives of Ḫinnaya on the day that you arrive and cause them to hear the tablet of my instruction and sell my tin and textiles on credit to a trustworthy merchant -as trustworthy as yourselves.
Do not overvalue 1 or 2 months.
Your merchants must be trustworthy.

1 talent 5 minas tin, 2 textiles as wrappings, and 6 kutānum-textiles which you brought to Aššur-šamšī s. Ibni-ilī, when you arrive in Kanesh, take care to send the tin, textiles, and tablets of my te'ertum written to Aššur-šamšī wherever he is.
Also, send you te'ertum.
Two packages of 5 minas tin are placed in the top of the pack.
1 minas 15 shekels silver which I owe you, my dear brother, please sell it at an 8 shekel rate and take your silver.
Smuggle the tin.
At an 8 shekel rate above or below, you can take your silver.
From Buzutaya, Ennum-Bēlum and Puzur-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn:
After we sent the silver from the cargo of Ilī-bāni, Tarmana gave us 2 minas 45 shekels silver.
Dalaš (gave to us) 1 mina (silver).
Aššur-ṭāb took 4 shekels.
There are 8 shekels of poor quality (silver).
7 shekels are deductions.
The remainder of the silver is 5 minas 26 shekels.
From the 2 minas 31 shekels of your silver about which there is agreeing(?), they deducted from us 1 mina 6 shekels on account of Puzur-Aššur.
Let it be released there with you.
We took the remainder of the silver, 1 minas 24 shekels.
Altogether 4 minas 50 shekels.
We weighed out 3 minas 16 shekels for (21-ma?).
Thereof, the remainder of the silver is 1 minas 34 shekels.

Also, Puzur-Aššur gave us 1 minas 13 1/2 shekels silver and concerning 2 minas 37 shekels silver which was in Il-bāni's cargo for the filling of the sack, he said, "That which we took for you on interest, we will weigh out the silver and its interest."
From Aššur-bāni, Šalim-Aššur and Kulumaya to Pūšu-kēn:
Concerning Ennašum, Puzur-Ištar took your maid as security and asked about 1/2 mina silver from us.

Šū-Nunu took 8 1/3 shekels silver.
He obtained witnesses and I gave (them) to him.
Concerning his journey, if you gave to him, ?? I will give to him (?) take.

Puzur-Aššur and Ea-šar took the wages of the house of Šū-Laban.

From Aššur-idī to Aššur-taklāku:
With respect to my account, send word to your brothers with the travelers to make them stand (as representatives).
Concerning the silver I gave you, every shekel, as well as what I gave to you of your mother's, I have given a corresponding amount to your mother.
The silver has now become mine.
If the colony puts pressure on you, just say: "I shall deal with the silver on behalf of my father."
Do not mention anybody's name, and do not deposit any transport tariff.
If they force you to mention (anyone), then do so, but you will not share in the profit.

You wrote me.

You said, "I seized the 5 minas silver from Asqudum here. Also, I borrowed 10 minas silver on interest and I sent you the silver. The merchandise from Asqudum which I took, I will  convert  to silver and the silver on interest I will 'convert'and I will send you the rest of your silver."
2 talents 5 minas tin, 30  kutānum-textiles, 2 black donkeys, 5 minas 5 shekels exceedingly fine 'gold', and 11 shekels meteoric iron in lumps--all this my father gave to Asqudum.
I will pray for you in the presence of Aššur and my god.
My son, because you are grieved over every shekel of your silver, take heed so that up to a talent of silver or more goes out so that the silver of the man is seized.
You hold my tablet.
Concerning my tablet saying that it is I who (stands) for your authority which you will seize, the man earned the disdain of my father and my disdain.
Cause him to constantly fret and do me as big a favor as you can.
He ... my two textiles and he will bring/brought your (pl.) silver.
My message went to Timelkiya.
But as for you, send them from there so that they might send my silver with you.
They must not borrow a single shekel of silver.
Išār-bēlī my youth is with Asqudum.
Take care to lead him away immediately.

1 mina ... let him make you the representatives.

To Amur-Ištar: I gave you 1 mina of silver, saying: "Give it to my representatives in the City."

.. they did not want to ...

... days ...

Let your message come concerning the tin and textiles in the transport of Kulumaya and Agua.

As much silver as he sends(?) or is there from the transport of Kulumaya and Agua, if anything is sold, or of donkeys, wherever there is a single shekels of silver, clear it and dispatch Dān-Aššur here.
My dear brother, give heed to my instructions and so make me happy.
As for the silver owed by Puzur-Adad and Ennum-Aššur, if their term is up, have them pay.
Seal 30 minas silver and send it here.

1 package containing 30 minas of silver, its import duty added; 1 package containing 10 minas, its import duty added; 1 package of 11 minas from the votive offerings in all: 51 minas of silver in 3 packages, its import duty added, Puzur-šadue is bringing to you.

If Puzur-šadue is delayed well, if there is a caravan (and) Kulbānum is there,  then attach one of my servants to Kulbānum, pack their 30 minas and entrust it to an affiliated trader, so they may bring it to the City.

Regarding the tablet (in?) the house of Wašḫuba about which you wrote me, take Ilabrat-bāni with you, open my tablet, and take out the tablet stating 49 minas silver (owed by) Anaḫ-ilī, his sister the gubabtum priestess, and Āl-ṭāb his brother concerning the two houses they entered, --there are these men denoted in the supplementary tablet -- wherever these men are denoted as judges, blot them with water so they are erased.
Let your hand seize them--

Zupa will pay our the share.

1/2 mina 5 shekels of silver, 6 1/4 shekels of gold belonging to Aššur-nādā's daughter, 1/3 mina 5 shekels of silver including that of my sacrifice, Arši-ah brought.
1/3 mina 1 shekel of silver were (separate) shipments-all this belongs to Aššur-nādā.

en-nam-xxx owes Aḫu-waqar 2 talents 50 minas fine copper scraps.

I gave 2 1/2 minas in sickles to the caravanserai at Tegarama.

You left me 3 2/3 minas of silver;
1 mina 1/2 shekel of silver belongs to Šū-Ištar;
2 minas less 1/2 shekel of silver you sent to me with Ištar-pilah;

Thereof I sent off to you goods worth 2 minas 16 2/3 shekels less 7 1/2 grains with Aššur-nādā son of Irnuid;

16 1/2 shekels of silver to Šū-Suen (and) 4 1/2 shekels to Asqūdia--
I gave to them, they are bound by contract.

Seize him to have him pay.
After the price of the copper and 1 shekel 15 grains of silver, which he owed to you, had been paid, I paid as balance to Aššur-rē'ī 23 shekels 22 1/2 grains of silver.
1/3 mina of silver, the price of a donkey, I paid to Uṣur-ša-Aššur.
The day you left you took 5 minas of scrap metal worth 4 shekels of silver.
The export duty was 1/2 shekel 15 grains;
you wrote me about it, and I added it.
As to the 5 1/2 minas of silver carried by Ennam-Aššur, 3 shekels were found to be missing during the check, but I forgot to charge it to you at the accounting.
2 sheep belonging to Pidaya's son: 5 1/2 mina;
1 sheep worth 1 5/6 mina belonging to Iddin-ilum;
1 sheep: 3 minas, 1 sheep 2 1/3 minas 5 shekels, 1 sheep: 2 minas 10 shekels belonging to Aššur-rē'ī;
1 sheep worth 2 1/3 minas belonging to Zua;
1 sheep worth 2 2/3 minas belonging to Dunnia;
1 sheep worth 3 1/3 minas--the same Dunnia's eldest son.
You forgot 1 textile worth 8 2/3 minas belonging to Aššur-ṭab, so I paid.
The total in copper: 32 minas less 5 shekels, in silver: 1/3 mina less 5/6 shekels, I have paid as the price of the textile and the sheep which you forgot about.
I paid as compensation 1[+ x] shekels after the transport tariff on your silver transported by Bēlī-ālum and the son of the priest.
After the transport tariff had been spent I paid as compensation 3 less 1/4 shekels of silver to Ištar-pilah and Irnuid's son.
1 mina of silver I spent on the price of 2 oxen and grain to feed the sons.
The rest of your silver: 2 minas 2/3 shekels, I deducted from the 5 minas 1 shekel of silver, the shipment transported by Ennam-Bēlum;
send the rest of my silver, 2 minas 1/3 shekels as soon as possible.
Do not be angry.
I wanted it for the men, so I took it.

to Aššur-nādā:

"Reckoned from the month Tanbarta in the eponymy of Ibni-Adad son of Baqqunum he is to pay 1 mina per year

Pilaḫ-Išṭar seized us against Enna-Suen:
Enna-Suen said: "The debt is for two years.

I said: "You are the son of a dead man and I am the son of a dead man. Let us not litigate. If you have the tablet refering to (its) payment in full or you have witnesses, arraign them so that I can ..discuss with them..?"
Enna-Suen said: "I do not hold any tablet of (its) payment in full, and I do not have witnesses. I am young and I do not know the seals of my father. Let me establish a witness to his seal and I..."
Month: Ab-šarrānē.
Year: Šū-Suen.
The sons of Lālum seized me:
I said: "I am the son of a dead man, and you are sons of a dead man. My father left me a tablet. As for the tablet, make known whether the seals are the seasl of your father or not."
The sons of Lālum said: "Bring out the tablet so that we can idetnify the seals."
I said: "Identify the seals so that I can realease the tablet to you."
They did not want to identify the seals on the tablet.
I said: "Lo, you must swear by the oath of the city and the prince. Make offerings."
They did not want to identify that they were the seals (in question).
Month: Kuzalli.
After they did not k'l the tablet, they did not want to identify.

From Ennum-Aššur to Pilaḫ-Ištar:
My dear brother and lord, besides you I have no brother.
Pilaḫ-Ištar seized the sons of Lālum against us.
They did not want to identify the seals on the tablet.
... They did not want to identify that they were the seals.
Pilaḫ-Ištar seized us against Aššur-emūqī and Itūr-ilī, the sons of Ikūnum.
They said: "We will stand."
To Idī-abum, Aššur-mālik, Aššur-imittī, Šū-Anum, Enna-Suen, and Puzur-ilī, from Pilaḫ-Ištar:
The message of the amtum wife has come to me once or twice.
Regarding Ilī-nādā s. Baziya, why is it that over there he constantly threatens to distrain my amtum-wife, attempts to seal the house and constantly frightens my people?
My father was alive ten years ago, during the plague.
Why did he not seize my father?
Or not deposit memoranda to my father?
Iliš-tikal assembled my father's silver.
Why did he not take from my father's silver, or from the attorney or give a memoranda to Iliš-tīkal?
I and my brothers met five times with him, in Purušḫattum, Ulama, and Waḫšušana!
Why didn't he give us any memoranda?
And how is it that his messages never came?
Nor did he send messages to his representatives with the result that they did not write (anything) down.

Also, his son, Šū-Bēlum, served as caravan driver with me, and he was constantly taking 1 or 2 minas silver in his bundle to him in Ulama and he did not 'ripen' the merchandise in the house of his own father.
Why did he not seize from my silver?
My dear fathers and lords, do you not know that because a robbery occurred when my father died, much silver and my father's tablets were stolen?
My dear fathers, my brothers opened the strongroom five years ago and since then it has been deposed for a matter.
As for my brothers, it is heard they are on the caravans.
But here, I myself have released 1 or 2 minas silver each day at the gate of the market and because of this I am thus made to assemble.
If Ilī-nādā prosecutes the case there, he will claim everything.
My dear fathers and lords, I am the son of a dead man!
I will come to [GN] and we will set [the matter before] the colony so that they will raise [the matter] to the city and [resolve this?].

Here I will clear myself and will come so that we can open my father's strongroom and inspect the tablets and the memoranda and clear the matter for the man, and those that stood at the head of my father here (will) search.
Becasue that silver is his debt, and we wrote him down for that silver, he will not (return)? it to Kalaluwa for him.
A great many of my fathers tablets were stolen!

Kukkulānim s. Ikuppiya owes the merchant 1 mina refined silver.
He will pay five years from the ḫamuštum of Šu-Ištar s. Aššur-bāni.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.
Month: Qarrātim.
Eponymate: Samaya.
Witnesses: Ikuppiya, Ḫurzibim,
Week: Ša Aššuriš-tikal s. Sukkallīya.
Witnesses: Aniya s. Ilī-bāni, Aššur-lamassī s. Nūr-Suen.
Witnesses: Ištar-ilšu s. Aššur-imittī, Šū-Kūbim s. Šalim-Aššur.
Ennanim s. Šu-Kūbim owes Puzur-Ištar s. Ḫinnaya 8 shekels refined silver.
Week: ša Qarwāya.
He will add interest according to the rate of the colony.
Witnesses: Šuma-abiya s. Qātātum, Ennum-Aššur s. Idī-Suen, Abīya s. Attaya.
Witnesses: Attaya, Šū-Anum.
Ennanim s. Azua owes Elamma 2 minas refined silver
Month: ša kēnātim.
Eponymate: after Aššur-damiq s. Abarsisin.
Ḫamuštum: Aššur-imittī s. Attaya.
He will pay 2/3 minas in one year.
If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.
Witnesses: Ennanim, Lā-qēpim.
Witnesses: Abu-šalim s. Idari, Idī-Aššur s. pu-ur-sí-sì-im.
If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels interest per mina per month according to the colony rate.
Šumī-abiya owes Elamma 1/2 mina refined silver.
He will pay 1 shekel interest per month from the hamuštum of Ilī-nādā.
Month: Bēlet-ekallim.
Šuli s. Puzur-abiḫ and Al-aḫam his brother will ... 1 kutānum to Elamma.
If they do not .. it, Šuli will pay about 1/2 mina silver to Elamma.
He will add, interest per mina according to the rate of the colony from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-mālik ṣallānum.
Eponymate: The one after Bazia s. Šepapalum.
Month: Narmak Aššur ša kēnātim.
Eponymate of Šū-Ḫubur.
Iziz-Mīšar owes 18 shekels silver.
Ku-pu-ur-ší-ni-IN owes Imlik-Aššur and Irma Aššur 2 shekels fine gold.
He will pay 15 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Iddinaya.
If he does not pay (on time), He will add (interest) at the rate of the colony.
Witnesses: Pilaḫ-Aššur s. Dānum-ilī, Aššur-mālik s. Azuza.
Malšawašḫi owes the merchant  15 shekels silver.
Seals:
Muza, daughter(!) of Ispunuman, is the wife of Šu-Bēlum.
Šu-Bēlum can take her along where <he> wishes.
If she wants to go away from him or commits a crime of an improper act, Muza will pay to Šu-Bēlum 1 mina of silver and Šu-Bēlum can go where he wishes.
If she wants to go away from him or commits a crime or an improper act, Muza will pay to Šu-Bēlum 1 mina of silver;
Šu-Bēlum can go where he wishes.
In the presence of Ṣulula, of Inib-Aššur, of Ennum-Aššur, of Perua.
--a-šur owes the merchant 4 shekels silver.
He will pay one month (from) the month of Allanātum.
If he does not pay, he will add (as interest) 1/3 shekel per month.
Eponymate: Aššur-nādā.
Ḫamuštum: The week after Qarwāya.
Witnesses: Aššsur-idī
Aššur-taklāku s. Aya owes Šū-Bēelum 4 shekels silver.
Witnesses: Aššur-idī.
Seals:
Puzur-Ištar s. Ilī-nādā owes the merchant 3 shekels silver.
Seals: Adad-pilah s. Anninim, Aššur-lamassī s. Lāqēp, Nazi s. Puzur-pān-ili
Aššur-lamassī s. Lāqēp owes Elamma 3 minas refined silver.
Šuli s. Puzur-Abiḫ owes Elamma 8 minas silver.
He will pay 14 ḫamuštum weeks from the hamuštum of Aššur-rēṣī.
Seals: Šū-Ištar s. Ennum-Aššur, Ikūn-mīšar s. Ilī-dān
Ikūn-mīšar s. Ilī-dān owes Elamma 8 shekels refined silver.
Seals: Ididi, Dudurim, Aššur-nādā, Aššur-dūrī
Aššur-dūrī owes Elamma 2 minas 10 shekels refined silver.
Balṭušar owes Elamma 0.5 minas refined silver.
He will pay 6 months from the ḫamuštum of Sukanim and Kura.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.
Seals: Idī-Suen s. Itur-ilī, Nāb-Suen s. Abī-ilī, Idnāya s. Kudāya
Idī-Suen s. Itūr-ilī owes Aššur-ṭāb 12 shekels refined silver.
Seals: Aššur-Šamši s. Ilī-tūram
Ištar-ilšu s. Azuza owes Aššur-ṭāb 2/3 minas 5 shekels refined silver.
