From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn:
If you are inclined, on the day that you read this tablet, send me 13 1/3 minas silver, its excise added, and I, for my part, will deposit double (lit. two shares).
While our shared merchandise travels up toward you, I will make any purchases which you write to me and send them to you.
On the day that Dān-Aššur arrives there, you can take your silver from the first sales you make, so that he (Dān-Aššur) brings my silver to me.
Until much tin goes with the caravan, I say, "Dān-Aššur, at his arrival, let them not travel overland for every shekels of silver, nor sell.
Let the later deposit 'go' so that a 1/2 or 1/3 extra  mina arises between us.
I have invested 6 1/2 minas 9 2/3 shekels of silver transported by me in the enterprise of Aššur-taklāku son of Šū-Illil;
I shall receive it from the fund of the enterprise.

2 5/6 minas of silver from the fund, 1 mina 9 shekels from the dividends, 1 donkey belonging to me, 1 donkey belonging to our father, 1 donkey belonging to Alāhum, we shall take from Šū-Nūnu's enterprise.
Aššur-taklāku will take 1 1/3 mina of silver from the fund, 2/3 mina 2 2/3 shekels from the dividends of the enterprise of Šū-Nūnu.
12 minas  of copper out of 80 minas each, in Burušhaddum belonging to Aššur-nādā, 6 minas belonging to our father remain.
When there was an opportunity to invest 20 textiles, I deposited 1 1/2 black textiles; the
When there was an opportunity to invest 15
Aššur-taklāku deposited 1
The silver for this accrues to me.
3 shekels of silver in the 5 percent tax on textiles in Burušhaddum; 4 shekels for the tithe in textiles from Kasia's enterprise are with Aššur-taklāku.
There is a second tablet.
From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā:
You sent me 2 minas less 1/2 shekel of silver with Ištar-pilah.
I took 1 mina 1/2 shekel out of what belongs to Šū-Ištar.
In all: 3 minas of silver.
Thereof I paid 7 1/2 shekels as import duty; since the (money for the) transport tariff had been spent, I paid the balance of 1 shekel of silver.
The rest of your silver amounts to 2 5/6 minas 1 1/2 shekel.
I borrowed 8 shekels of silver from the son of Abu-šalim and his partner.
I still had a claim against you of 2 2/3 minas 1 1/4 shekels of silver, the proceeds from the sale of the textiles transported by Ennam-Bēlum.
You said: ''The silver has been taken."
But I forgot to seal it, (and) since I have no silver available to me I have taken it.
I also still had a claim of 16 shekels 15 grains of silver from the goods transported by the son of Irnuid.
In all: 2 5/6 minas 7 1/3 shekels have been deducted, so the rest of your silver is 2 1/6 shekels.
It has been spent for you.
To Alāhum, Aguza, Aššur-nādā and Ilī-alum from Aššur-idī:

5 shekels of iron: Ili-iddinaššu son of Aššur-nādā; 2 shekels of iron: Ikuppia son of Aššur-dān; 6 minas of tin: Ikūnum son of Samaya -- Puzur-Ištar son of Saktaya has given them (this) as an interest-free loan.
He owes 23 1/2 minas of silver to us, and it is us they have satisfied.
My dear brothers, take care to support Aššur-bēl-awātim and Amria, raise the silver and divide it up jointly in shares for you of 4 minas, and send that to me.

Out of the 30 minas of lapis lazuli owned jointly by Šū-Illil, Aššur-malik, myself and Amur-Ištar, i.e. out of all of the lapis lazuli, I checked 5 minas of lapis lazuli and a seal costing 1/3 mina (of silver) was deposited with it.
He said: "I shall sell these either in Kaneš or in Hahhum, and I shall acquire silver for you."

Please, the man must not cheat you, so when you make the division, if he has not brought the lapis lazuli carried by him, has not deposited it in front of you, so that you have not (been able) to send it jointly, or divided it, then do not favour the man with any extras!
The lapis lazuli carried by him is of outstanding quality.
Aššur-rabi s. a-šùr-ì-šu owes Idí-Kūbum s. Uṣur-ša-Aššur 15 shekels ṭīrē silver.
He will pay the silver in one month.
Month: ...
ga-ar-šu-nu-a and Aššur-nimrī owe Idí-Kūbum s. Uṣur-ša-Aššur ? minas 4 shekels silver.
They will pay the silver in two months.
If they do not pay (on time), they will add ? shekels of silver (per mina) per month as interest.
Month: Ḫubur
Eponymate: Ikuppiya s. Šalim-Aššur.
Usānum s. Amur-Aššur owes the merchant 3 minas refined silver
To Imdī-ilum, Pūšu-kēn, Ikūnum, Iddin-abum, and Ḫadāya from Amur-Ištar:
Ikūnum holds 5 minas of my silver for interest.
9 2/3 minas together with its interest he ... to Ḫadāya.
Ḫadāya gave me 4 minas from that amount.
Also, 2 minas (silver) are deposited to Ikūnum and Qarwāya for
Ḫadāya retains the remainder of my silver, 3 2/3 minas.
Though I myself have been looking to him for 3 2/3 minas silver and its interest for 10 years, today I am paying him back 1 minas 10 shekels silver!
As for the matter, as much as Imdi-ilum placed on him, until we see each other, let (Imdī-ilum) (deposit?) it.
Take a sealed document from him.
So that my words are not tread on, gather Qarwiya, Ikūnum and Ḫadāya--all of them--concerning the 2 minas silver.
Let Ikūnum and Qarwiya ... be bound and let each give one mina amongst them (for) 2 minas refined silver and its interest which for 10 years wherever iburani.
My dear brothers and lords do not turn them away.
Do not show them mercy.
Am I not (your) junior?
As for the 10 minas package, m. and š., therein he sold 8 minas to Imdī-ilum.
The remainder is 2 minas.
20 minas metal scraps, 1 sh,  x pa-shu-x naqubu - weighing 6 minas, 1 boxwood log, length is 3 in a cubit, and width 1 k., 3 minas of sh, 20 ep from Talḫada, therein,
A weight of 6 minas, 1 (log of)? boxtree.
Its length is within 3 cubits.
Its width is about 1 kabsu.
Cause Ḫadāya to give all this.
Aššur-lamassī s. Puzur-Anna owes Atata ? mina(s) 5 shekels refined silver.
He will pay the silver 1 year from the month of Allanātum eponymate of Ḫanna-nārum.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels silver per mina per month as interest.
From Ilī-bāni to Suen-nādā:
720 pots of wheat -- votive offering (belonging to the temple) of Adad -- are due from Ennum-Aššur.
Their copper is 720 minas.
To Zukša and Šāt-Aššur say: thus (says) Nab-Suen.
We are well.
Do not worry!
We hear good news from various sides.
As soon as we obtain (a decision in) our legal case, I will send with the first messenger (news about) our well-being.
Do not worry!
To Amur-Ištar and Uṣur-ša-Aššur say: thus (says) Aššur-ṭāb.
You are my fathers, you are my lords.
There is no road anywhere to move forward.

(Regarding) my messenger whom we sent to the (Tuḫpiya) colony, as concerns the opening of the road to Tuḫpiya, take care to report (about the matter): my messenger shoudl be sent to me so that I shall not be delayed here.
Let your report in this respect come here and do inform me.
To Uṣur-ša-Aššur say:
X-tikal should pay 1/2 mina of silver to you.
The merchandise which you sent me has safely arrived.
Until you make the purchases, the silver should remain in safekeeping under your own seal.
Iliš-tīkal gave 4 minas refined silver to Enlil-bāni.
From the hamuštum-week of Aššur-imittī and Aššur-rabi, he will pay 8 minas in 4 years.
Month: Narmak Aššur.
Eponymate: The one after the year of Šudāya.
As much as he takes he will receive to the name of his narruqum.
As much as Enlil-bāni 'treads' and Ilš-tīkal, as much as (there is?) to him, he will receive with the result that his joint stock fund will enter into the house of Iliš-tīkal.
Witnesses: Lālum, Ennānum.
From Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn:
My dear brothers, my tin and textiles should not be stocked up.
Sell (the tin) on short terms at a rate of 9 shekels or higher; otherwise, sell as much as can be sold on long terms.

Let your report come as to how much of my goods—those from the cargo of Erraya’s son (Aššur-mālik), those that Dān-Aššur drove, and those from the caravan of Šū-Enlil’s son—(that is) my tin and textiles, cleared (the palace).
Let your report come regarding the five kusītum-robes, the 1 nibrarum-textile from the cargo of Dān-Aššur, and the price of the donkeys, as much as you bought.

As for the 30 minas 27 shekels of silver on terms about which you wrote me—10 minas 10 shekels of silver of the sons of Aššur-šamšī and 5 minas of silver of Ḫinnaya—have all this paid and send it to me at the first opportunity.
A tablet recording the will of Aššur-imittī is with Šalim-Aššur son of Ennum-Aššur in Ḫurrama.
Send to him to have the tablet brought to you.
Wrap up the tablet in straw, and carefully entrust (it) to a reliable affiliated trader so that he may bring it to me.
Give a shekel of silverfrom the silver to the bearer of the tablet.
Abatim and ku-ki-ni-im his son owe Aḫu-waqar 2 minas 25 shekels refined silver.
He will pay 8 weeks from the ḫamuštum after Amurrum-bāni and Aššur-nādā.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.
Month: Ṣipʾem.
Seals:
Abatim and ku-ki-ni-im his son owe Aḫu-waqar 2 minas 25 shekels refined silver.
He will pay 8 weeks from the ḫamuštum after Amurrum-bāni and Aššur-nādā.
If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.
Month: Ṣipʾem.
Eponymate: (Ašsur-nādā s. Puzur-Anna).
From Ili-imittī to Aššur-rabi and Aššur-imittī:
To Aššur-rabi:
Against the will of the gods, Ṭāb-Aššur, your brother's son, has died.
Also, I seized about a mina of silver of his assets from a transaction.
Come!
If he is not there, write to him wherever he is!
Dispatch him with Kurub-Ištar.
Puzur-Ištar seized us against Adad-rēʾī:
Puzur-Ištar said, "Give me my silver."
They gave silver, the price of 2 talents poor copper, 4 talents fine copper, and the price of the donkey-15 shekels silver.
To Ḫašušarna from Aššur-taklāku and Idī-Šamaš:
On the day you read our letter, set out and come to Tegarama.
Remain in Tegarama for my instruction.
Before departure, let your report come on the day you depart.
Come and hold on to the silver from Waḫšušana.
To Aḫatum from Puzur-ilī:
The situation is drastic.
Within one month, he will (be forced to) clear the matter with me.
When I come, will you not do me a favor regarding Ḫaṣabšilum's silver and interest?
Take it on yourself.
Here, the price of
Let your report come as to whether this is the case or not.
To Pūšu-kēn from Idī-Kūbum:
On the day that the merchandise exits the palace, dispatch my merchandise with the first traveller.
My dear father and lord, take care!
Who (else) can I trust?
May Aššur and your god witness that I indeed sent you the silver gained from your tin!
If I did indeed take it, I certainly (would not have) deposited in my own funds!
Before the wind (can blow???) resolve, dispatch my goods to me!
Take care!
Ḫaburatāyum Šabūrum owes x talents 13 minas good copper to Aššur-mālik s. Takua sú-i-dá-dá.
Witnesses: Ikūnum s. Šamaš-bāni, Aššuriš-tikal s. Ḫinnāya, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Aššur-šasuni.
Aššur-imittī s. Ikuppī-Ištar owes Enli-bāni 2 1/2 minas refined silver.
He will add 1 shekel per mina per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ennānum s. Šū-Ḫubur.
Month: Kuzallī.
Eponymate: Akūtum.
The colony owes Enlil-bāni 6 minas refined silver.
They will add 2/3 shekel 15 grain per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštim of Kurub-Ištar, month of Ša sarrātim, eponymate after Enna-Suen.
Aššur-mutabbil s. Pūšu-kēn owes Enlil-bāni 2 minas refined silver.
He will add 1 shekel (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ennam-Aššur s. Šalmiḫim, month of Kanwarta, eponymate of Maṣi-ilī.
Zukuwa s. Aššur-idī owes Enlil-bāni 2 1/3 minas refined silver, verified according to my silver mina weight.
He will add 1 shekel (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Puzur-Ištar, month of Kanwarta, eponymate of Akūtum.
Al-aḫim s. Šalma-Aššur owes Enlil-bāni 1 1/2 minas refined silver.
He will add 1 shekel (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Aḫu-waqar, month of Qarrātim, eponymate of Maṣi-ilī.
Adad-rabi and Šū-Suen son of Puzur-Anna owe Enlil-bāni 1 mina refined silver.
They will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ennam-Aššur.
Month: Kanwarta.
Eponymate: Maṣi-ilī.
Buzazu owes Enlil-bāni 2 minas refined silver.
He will add 1 shekel (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Luzina, month of Bēlet-ekallim, eponymate after Akūtum.
Aššur-rabi s. Lā-qēpim owes Enlil-bāni 1 mina 15 shekels refined silver.
He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ikuppiya s. Šū-Anim, month of Allānātum, eponymate of Enna Suen.
Ṭāb-ṣilli-Aššur s. Puzur-Niraḫ owes Enlil-bāni 30 shekels refined silver.
He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Idī-abim, month of Ab šarrānē, eponymate after Akūtum.
Puzur-Šamaš and Aššur-imittī sons of Šū-Nunu owe Enlil-bāni 40 shekels refined silver.
They will pay one month from the ḫamuštum of Aššuriš-takil, month Teʾinātim, eponymate of Maṣi-ilī.
If they do not pay, they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) as interest.
From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Ilabrat-bāni, specifically to Ilabrat-bāni:
From Lā-qēpum's tablet: "Ilabrat-bāni took 6 1/3 minas tin from your sack and at that time he went to Hattum."
Ilī-ašranni brought a white kusītum robe for my votive offering to Aššur-mālik.
But Aššur-mālik did not arrive.
He had departed.
You took the kusītum robe yourself.
You said, "It is delivered to my father."
You promised 15 shekels silver to Dān-Aššur.
You said, "I will send it after you."
You have held that one since the year of Aḫ-marši (REL 79).
My dispatch came to you five times!
Give Pūšu-kēn the silver for the tin, the kusītum robe, and the half kutānum textile.
Or, send so that I can take from your silver here.
Aššur-mālik son of Azua brings you three textiles belonging to my votive fund (and) one textile for the girl with your textiles.
Give a mina of silver to Pūšu-kēn so that he puts it in my silver.
Are you not constantly hearing that every year, wherever we sell, I must quarrel with groups of five or ten people concerning even a single shekel of your silver?
May Aššur and Ilabrat witness that whenever I give a single shekel of silver, I am bereft of 10 or 20 minas of my silver.
My dear brother, do not anger me!
Give my silver to Pūšu-kēn.
Or send to me so that I may take from your silver here.
Do not anger me!
10 2/3 mina silver is with Amur-Aššur s. Išme-ilī.
From the ḫamuštum of Ḫa-bi₄-a-aḫ-šu and Lāqēp he has 30 weeks to pay.
3 1/2 mina 9 shekels silver is with Puzur-ilī s. Uṣur-ša-Ištar.
Puzur-Ištar s. Ipìlís and Mannum-bālum-Aššur s. Dunnīya owe 3 mina 13 1/2 shekels silver.
From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim they have one month to pay.
3 1/2 minas silver is with Dudu s. Ištar-bāni.
From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī he has 20 weeks to pay.
1/3 mina 2/3 shekel silver is will Iziz-Mīšar.
2 1/3 minas 5 shekels silver is with Aššur-nādā and 16 shekels is separately with him?
From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī he has one month to pay.
2 minas is with Ḫu-bi-iš-nu-ma-an and Šili-uman . . . Nipas will pay.
1/3 mina capital is with Al-abim.
3 minas silver is with Ki-dí-im.
From the ḫamuštum of Ḫanānum and Šalim-Aššur he has 40 weeks to pay.
1 mina - 1 2/3 shekels is with A-bi₄-lá-ma-sí, I-tù-a-ri-ší will pay.
10 shekels is with Ennamānim s. Uta-aḫum.
2/3 minas 4 shekels silver is with Nāb-Suen s. Gal-ga-ri-im in the city will pay.
Šalim-Aššur owes 3 minas refined silver to Buzutaya.
Witnesses: Amur-Aššur, Amur-Šamaš, Šū-Bēlim
To Šalim-aḫum: Lā-qēpum, Iliya, and Pūšu-kēn:
After we deducted the excise tax and the deficiencies, they cleared your tin—122 minas 8 shekels.
27 kūtānum-textiles, 4 textiles as wrappings, all this Son of Erradi turned over to us.
We have not yet cleared accounts with him.
Your donkeys died.
Thereof, 20 kutānum-textiles at 1/2 mina each, 4 šurum-textiles at 15 shekels each, 7 shekels for your tin, we bundled together and 28 minas 27 shekels is placed on the merchant on long terms.
The remainder of your kutānum-textiles is 7 textiles.
They are deposited in your account.
130 minas tin, 4 textiles as wrappings, 5 kutānum-textiles, 1 black donkey (all) of the šēpum of Aššur-mutabbil--Nūr-Ištar drove 26 kutānum-textiles, 1 black donkey here.
One donkey died.
Thereof, 1 1/2 textiles (were) the excise tax.
And we balanced 1 shekel silver.
3 textiles were for 'purchases.'
1/2 textile is with Ilabrat-bāni.
They cleared the remainder of your textiles—26 textiles.
From the 2 talents 10 minas tin from the šēpum of Aššur-mutabbil, 4 minas were the excise tax.
4 minas 54 shekels were lost.
After the hand tin was exhausted, we remitted Aššur-mutabbil 7 minas 27 shekels tin.
They cleared the remainder of your tin—53 minas 39 shekels.
We took 11 minas tin from the caravan of Aššur-mālik at the colony office and placed it with your tin.
The total was 2 talents 4 minas 39 shekels.

Your tin—at a 7 shekel rate, 26 kutānum-textiles—at a 1/2 mina each, a donkey—for 1/2 mina, in all the silver from your tin and textiles and donkey—31 minas 18 1/2 shekels—is placed on a merchant on long terms.
4 textiles of the wrappings are placed in your account.
From the 6 talents 30 minas tin of the šēpum of Aḫ-šalim, 21 minas was the excise tax..
The deficiencies were 3 minas 10 shekels.
The remainder of your tin was 6 talents  5 5/6 minas.

Thereof, 304 minas 40 shekels (tin) at a rate of 8 shekels and 50 kutānum-textiles together with šurum-textiles which were seized, at a rate of 20 shekels (we gathered(?), and) 54 minas 45 shekels silver on long terms are placed on a merchant.
... he will pay in 42 hamuštum weeks.
Al-aḫum and Šalim-Aššur owe 12 minas 47 shekels less 22 1/2 grains.
He will pay 45 weeks from the ḫauštum week after the ḫamuštum week of Lā-qēpum and Ilī-ālum, month Allanātum, eponymate of Aḫ-marši.
Lulu s. Azua owes 13 2/3 minas.
[He will pay ...] from the hamuštum week of the kaššum official after the week of Lā-qēpum and Ilī-alum.
Ana... owes x minas silver.
He will pay 45 weeks after the hamuštum of Šukkutum and Uraya, month of Qarrātum, year of Aḫ-marši.
PN s. Šū-Ilabrat owes 15 minas 38 1/s shekels.
He will pay 40 hamuštum weeks after the hmuštum week of the kaššum official after the ḫamuštum week of Lā-qēpum and Ilī-ālum, month of Teʾinātum, year of Idī-Aššur.
Asqudum and Ilī-uṣranni owe 32 minas 51+x shekels.
They will pay 20+x weeks after the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī and Amur-Ištar, month of Narmak Aššur ša kēnātim, year after the year of Sukkalliya.
Šū-Suen
[He will pay x ḫamuštum weeks?] from the ḫamuštum of [PN and] x-tí-a-x, month [of MN, year LN.]
From Ilīya and Lā-qēpum to Idī-Ištar:
Your silver and your shipment, in accordance with your tablet, is well.
The son of Suetaya brought it here.
Your investors seized the silver.
To Pūšu-kēn, Innāya, and Iliya from Šū-Kūbum; to Innāya
To Innāya:
When you came as
You said, "I have arrived being stretched thin."
You said, "Let me go and see my copies in Kanesh and inspect both mine and Aššur-bāni's šēpum and write you a detailed message. None of your property will be lost."

Set out(?) so that according to the letter which you wrote me, which I hold, the losses, the excise-tax, the tithe which the palace took, and that which you placed on the merchants are credited (to me) and you send the remainder of the textiles, 25 1/2 black textiles.
You wrote me.
You said, "Puzur-Suen and Šū-Suen brought 15 1/2 black textiles to Waḫšušana."
To this day I have been continually writing you, yet you have not responded a word.
Previously, hardly had I myself seized Šū-Suen here, when you wrote me.
You said, "I will receive the silver from Puzur-Suen and send it to you."
silver ... my share ... my share ... I myself brough the silver to you ... you owe
As for you, to whom will you pay the silver?
From the four donkeys you wrote me (in your tablet), "1 donkey died. Three are standing."
Their price is your responsibility, so from the 25 minas tin of my debt, which until Burallim therein, the matter of 15 minas x shekels of silver you gave me.
You said, "I will go and I will have that 10 minas (of silver) paid out and I will send it to you."
You recieved it.
Why did you not send it?
You owe all this: 11 2/3 minas of silver from your previous šēpum.
Ennam-Aššur son of Suen-nādā owes a debt to me.
His term is far past due but when you went (to him), you said, "The man owes me a favor. If he receives anything, then take it as a favor to me."
If it is not so, send as much silver as you can obtain.
If you said, "I didn't receive anything," send a message so that I may sue the man.
My silver, which you took from Zuzu after his term passed, why have you not sent it?
from the (matter?) ... my textiles ... in ...
The colony owes me 5 1/3 minas refined silver.
They entrusted to Ukubturuš 1 mina 5 shekels separately, but he did not pay me.
I will initiate legal proceedings against the colony.
Iddin-Abum s. Aššur-ṭāb gave 1 mina 15 shekels silver to Šalim-aḫum s. Dān-Aššur for management.
He will pay at his ascension from the city.
Iddin-abum s. Aššur-ṭāb will give to Šalim-aḫum s. Dān-Aššur separately 1 mina silver, his excise and exit tax added and he will pay 2 minas silver at his ascension from the city.
In total, Šalim-aḫum will pay 3 minas silver to Iddin-abum at his ascension from the city, whether in Kanesh or Ḫattum wherever he meets him.
Also, Šalim-aḫum will pay 1 mina ailver to Iddin-abum so that Iddin-abum s. Aššur-ṭāb will pay 2 minas silver to Šalim-aḫum s. Dān-Aššur at his ascension from the city.
Witnesses: Iliya s. Attay, Al-aḫum s. Šū-Laban, Pūšu-kēn s. Buzāzu.
He gave 2 minas refined silver to Ḫudurla s. Aššur-mālik as cash and Merali s. Ennum-Aššur will pay it to Idi-Aššur s. Aššur-ṭāb.
